sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: GTLB | GitLab Inc. Class A Stock Data, Price & News
feed.summary: This page provides comprehensive data for GitLab Inc. Class A (GTLB) stock, including real-time pricing, financials, analyst forecasts, and various institutional and insider trading activities. It features details on U.S. Congressional trading, corporate lobbying, executive compensation, and the company's operational model as a DevSecOps platform provider. The platform also offers tools for stock screening, backtesting strategies, and a "Smart Score" for evaluating stock strength.

feed.title: Alliant Energy Stock: Quiet Utility, Big Yield – Is It Enough Now?
feed.summary: Alliant Energy Corp. (NASDAQ: LNT) is presented as a stable, income-generating utility focused on Iowa and Wisconsin, offering modest growth and a dividend, positioning it between bond-like stability and growth. The article examines how rising interest rates, grid investments, and regulatory risks are reshaping its risk-reward profile, detailing what investors, analysts, and social trading communities should consider given these factors. It concludes that while suitable for income-focused and defensive portfolios, it won't meet aggressive capital gains expectations.

feed.title: What Live Nation Entertainment (LYV)'s 2025 Profit Drop Amid Rising Sales Means For Shareholders
feed.summary: Live Nation Entertainment reported increased sales in 2025 but a drop in net income and a loss per share from continuing operations. Despite weaker profitability, analysts are optimistic about the company's long-term position in live entertainment due to its expanding global venue footprint and growth in concert revenue, although antitrust scrutiny remains a key risk. The company's strategy of owning and operating more venues is noted as a significant factor in its investment narrative.

feed.title: A Look At Edison International (EIX) Valuation After Analyst Caution Strong Results And Bond Offering
feed.summary: Edison International (EIX) is attracting attention due to strong recent performance, a new bond offering, and analyst caution despite positive earnings guidance. The stock is currently trading above a consensus fair value estimate of $67.37, suggesting it might be overvalued, though its P/E ratio of 6.4x is significantly lower than the industry average, posing a question of whether market overreaction to risks is at play. Investors are advised to examine underlying numbers and various risk factors for a comprehensive understanding of the investment opportunity.

feed.title: Walmart cottage cheese recalled. Where and what products were affected
feed.summary: Saputo Cheese USA Inc. has recalled certain Great Value brand cottage cheese products sold at Walmart stores in 24 states due to concerns about incomplete pasteurization. The recall affects various sizes of Fat Free, Low Fat, and 4% Small Curd cottage cheese with "best by" dates of April 1, 2, or 3. Consumers are advised to dispose of the products or return them for a full refund, though no illnesses have been reported.

feed.title: Thermo Fisher’s TacroType Test Adds Precision Medicine Angle To TMO Story
feed.summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific has launched its TacroType Pharmacogenetic Test, designed to personalize tacrolimus dosing for transplant patients based on their genetic profile. This new product aims to enhance transplant care and post-transplant management, further positioning Thermo Fisher in the precision medicine and high-value diagnostics market. Investors will be observing its adoption by clinicians, integration into Thermo Fisher’s broader offerings, and impact on related diagnostics and lab solutions.

feed.title: A Look At Roper Technologies (ROP) Valuation After Its 2025 10 K And Software Focused Acquisitions
feed.summary: Roper Technologies (ROP) has gained attention after its 2025 10-K report showcased strong growth driven by software and technology-enabled products, supported by nine acquisitions. Despite a recent short-term increase in share price, the stock has seen declines over 90 days and one year. Simply Wall St estimates Roper is 23.8% undervalued with a narrative fair value of $462.19, based on assumptions of software-led growth and enhanced earnings predictability from subscription-based revenues.

feed.title: Realty Income Stock: A Buy, Hold or Sell Opportunity Post Q4 Earnings?
feed.summary: Realty Income (O) closed out 2025 with a steady quarter, showing consistent performance as a net-lease REIT with stable AFFO and strong portfolio metrics. Despite positive stock performance and a dividend hike, the article identifies that future growth largely depends on maintaining attractive investment spreads and managing execution risk with its aggressive 2026 investment plan. Given its modest projected growth, macro sensitivity to interest rates, and balanced risk-reward at current levels, the stock is rated a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) for income-focused investors.

feed.title: Honeywell (HON) Upgraded by Wolfe Research with a Target of $293
feed.summary: Wolfe Research has upgraded Honeywell International Inc. (HON) from 'Peer Perform' to 'Outperform', setting a new price target of $293 USD. This upgrade reflects Wolfe Research's positive outlook on Honeywell's strategic direction and market prospects, aligning with a broader consensus among analysts who have also recently adjusted their price targets upwards. Honeywell, a global multi-industry company, is strategically focusing on fewer end markets and expanding its installed base, with significant revenue from recurring aftermarket services.

feed.title: HERITAGE FINANCIAL CORP /WA/ SEC 10-K Report
feed.summary: Heritage Financial Corporation has released its annual Form 10-K report, highlighting a robust financial performance with a 56.1% increase in net income to $67.5 million and diluted EPS of $1.96. The company completed the acquisition of Olympic Bancorp, Inc., enhancing its market share in Washington, and strategically repositioned its investment portfolio. Heritage Financial aims for continued expansion through strategic acquisitions and organic growth in the Pacific Northwest while managing market, credit, and regulatory risks.

feed.title: What's Behind The Drop In Microsoft Stock?
feed.summary: Microsoft's stock is falling due to its exclusion from OpenAI's latest funding and partnership announcement, despite Microsoft's long-standing relationship with the AI company. OpenAI secured $110 billion in new investments from SoftBank, NVIDIA, and Amazon, while also forming new strategic partnerships. Microsoft reaffirmed its unchanged relationship with OpenAI, but this did not prevent its shares from sliding.

feed.title: Uber ride costs, safety and new US rules: what changed for your next trip
feed.summary: Uber rides in the US are undergoing significant changes regarding pricing, safety features, and driver regulations. These shifts mean more dynamic pricing, enhanced safety tools within the app, and local rules impacting driver availability and pay. Riders need to be aware of these changes as they can affect ride costs, safety perceptions, and the overall experience, moving Uber from a 'cheap by default' service to a more complex, flexible taxi replacement.

feed.title: NiSource (NYSE:NI) Sets New 12-Month High - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: NiSource (NYSE:NI) has reached a new 52-week high of $47.24, with a market capitalization of $22.56 billion. The company surpassed its quarterly earnings expectations with $0.51 EPS and $1.90 billion in revenue, and has provided FY2026 EPS guidance of $2.020–2.070. Analysts maintain a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating for NiSource, with an average target price of $47.20, and the company recently increased its quarterly dividend to $0.30 per share.

feed.title: Consolidated Edison Is Up 13% YTD. Is There More Upside Ahead?
feed.summary: Consolidated Edison (ED) stock has risen 13% year-to-date, trading near $112 per share, driven by reaffirmed long-term earnings growth targets, significant capital investment plans, and steady institutional accumulation. Despite a recent earnings miss, the company's predictable regulated returns and infrastructure spending are expected to expand its rate base and drive future earnings growth. TIKR's valuation model suggests a target price of $137, implying a 23% upside due to regulated rate base expansion, capital discipline, and consistent earnings.

feed.title: Kroger starts first wave of closures with 30 stores on the chopping block after failed $25B deal
feed.summary: Kroger has begun closing 30 underperforming stores across 13 states as part of an efficiency drive, following a failed $25 billion merger deal with Albertsons that was blocked by the FTC. The company plans to cut about 1,000 corporate positions but also aims to increase new store openings by 30% this year, focusing on larger "Kroger Marketplace" designs. Despite the closures, Kroger committed to offering roles at other locations for all affected employees.

feed.title: Insider Buying: CMS Energy (NYSE:CMS) Director Purchases 2,000 Shares of Stock
feed.summary: CMS Energy (NYSE:CMS) Director Diane Leopold recently purchased 2,000 shares of the company's stock for $153,400, increasing her holdings by over 260%. This insider buying follows CMS Energy's exceeding Q4 earnings estimates with $0.95 EPS and increased revenue, alongside a raised quarterly dividend to $0.57. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for the utilities provider, with a consensus target price of $79.08.

feed.title: Lennox International (NYSE:LII) Director Shane Wall Sells 100 Shares
feed.summary: Lennox International (NYSE:LII) Director Shane Wall sold 100 shares of the company's stock on February 25th at an average price of $540.01, reducing his stake by 4.34%. This transaction was disclosed in an SEC filing and results in Wall owning 2,205 shares valued at approximately $1.19 million. The company recently reported Q4 EPS of $4.45, missing estimates, and announced a quarterly dividend of $1.30 per share.

feed.title: Sempra Energy (NYSE:SRE) Given New $113.00 Price Target at Wells Fargo & Company
feed.summary: Wells Fargo & Company has raised its price target for Sempra Energy (NYSE:SRE) to $113.00 from $112.00, maintaining an "overweight" rating. This adjustment follows Sempra's Q4 earnings beat, increased five-year capital plan, and a modest dividend hike, despite a slight revenue miss and rising short interest. The new price target suggests a potential upside of 17.67% from the current stock price.

feed.title: 5 Analysts Have This To Say About Essex Property Trust
feed.summary: Five analysts have recently provided ratings for Essex Property Trust (NYSE: ESS), with perspectives ranging from somewhat bullish to indifferent. The average 12-month price target is $279.80, showing a 3.45% decrease from the previous average. Key financial metrics such as market capitalization, revenue growth, net margin, ROE, ROA, and debt-to-equity ratio are also detailed.

feed.title: Mark Rodgers plans to sell 4,443 NEM shares (NYSE: NEM) after vesting
feed.summary: Mark Rodgers has filed a Form 144 Notice of Proposed Sale of Securities, indicating his plan to sell 4,443 common shares of Newmont Corp (NYSE: NEM) following the vesting of restricted stock on February 26, 2026. The filing also revealed a prior sale of 5,147 common shares on February 25, 2026, for $643,375.00. These transactions are standard disclosures related to compensation vesting and are held at Fidelity Brokerage Services LLC.

feed.title: Is General Dynamics Stock Outperforming the Dow?
feed.summary: General Dynamics (GD) stock has shown strong performance, outpacing the Dow Jones Industrials Average ($DOWI) both year-to-date and over the past 52 weeks. Despite a recent earnings forecast miss and concerns about U.S. tariffs impacting 2026 profits, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a target price indicating an 11.2% premium. The company, a large-cap aerospace and defense firm, continues to trade above its 50-day moving average.

feed.title: Hasbro Seeks Refund on Trump-Era Tariffs After Supreme Court Ruling
feed.summary: Hasbro has filed a lawsuit seeking refunds for tariffs paid during the Trump administration, which were recently declared illegal by the Supreme Court. The toy company joins over 2,000 other businesses, including L'Oreal and Dyson, in pursuing similar claims for reimbursement plus interest from the federal government. This legal action follows a Supreme Court decision that invalidated the emergency trade policies under which these tariffs were collected.

feed.title: Clough Global Opportunities Fund Section 19(a) Notice
feed.summary: The Clough Global Opportunities Fund (GLO) announced a monthly distribution of $0.0537 per share to shareholders of record as of February 18, 2026, paid on February 27, 2026. The notice highlights that 100% of both the current and fiscal year-to-date cumulative distributions are estimated to be a return of capital. The fund also provided estimated distribution sources and stressed that these figures are for informational purposes, with actual tax reporting to be provided via Form 1099-DIV.

feed.title: Fidelity National Information Services Shares Slide 22.5% Below Goldstein's Purchase Price
feed.summary: Shares of Fidelity National Information Services (FIS) are trading 22.5% below the price at which Director Jeffrey A. Goldstein purchased 941 shares for $64.11 each on January 15. This dip makes FIS an attractive buy for bargain hunters, aligning with the Wall Street adage that insiders only buy when they expect to profit. The company also offers an annualized dividend of $1.76 per share, providing an approximate 3.5% yield.

feed.title: Globalstar, Inc. (GSAT) Stock: Reports Strong Q4 Growth Despite Losses
feed.summary: Globalstar, Inc. (GSAT) reported robust Q4 revenue of $71.96 million, exceeding expectations despite a loss of $0.07 per share. The company's stock rose by 4.00%, driven by strong growth in IoT and satellite services, including a 17% year-over-year increase in service revenue. Looking forward to 2026, Globalstar projects revenues between $280 million and $305 million, with analysts maintaining a "buy" rating and a target price of $66.50.

feed.title: Williams Companies Officer Sells Over 10,000 Shares
feed.summary: Mary A. Hausman, VP Chief Accounting Officer at Williams Companies, sold 10,107 shares of company stock for a total of $757,115 on February 26, 2026. This transaction leaves Hausman with a direct ownership of 17,230 shares in the company. The sale was reported in an SEC Form 4 filing.

feed.title: Europe just approved a combined flu and COVID shot. Why hasn’t the US?
feed.summary: European regulators have recommended authorization for Moderna's mCombriax, a combined flu and COVID-19 vaccine, for individuals aged 50 and older. This marks a significant step towards approval in the European Union, making it the world's first such combination vaccine. In contrast, the vaccine's approval in the United States remains uncertain due to strict FDA standards and additional hurdles, including initial reluctance from the Trump administration to review its application.

feed.title: SRE: Wells Fargo Raises Price Target for Sempra to $113 | SRE St
feed.summary: Wells Fargo has maintained an "Overweight" rating for Sempra (SRE) and increased its price target from $112.00 to $113.00, reflecting a 0.89% anticipated increase in the stock's performance. This adjustment comes amidst other analyst rating changes for Sempra in early 2026. The average target price from 15 analysts is $100.07, suggesting a 4.01% upside from the current price, while GuruFocus estimates a downside based on its GF Value.

feed.title: Ross Stores stock hits all-time high at 204.88 USD
feed.summary: Ross Stores Inc. stock has reached an all-time high of $204.88, reflecting a 49% increase over the past year and putting its market capitalization at $66.2 billion. Despite trading above its InvestingPro Fair Value, analysts from firms like Bernstein SocGen Group, UBS, and TD Cowen have raised their price targets for ROST, citing strong sales momentum, improved marketing, and strategic transformations. The company also recently acknowledged the passing of its former Chairman and CEO, Norman Ferber, who was key to its growth.

feed.title: Did Citi’s 30‑Day Catalyst Watch Ahead of Investor Day Just Shift KLA’s (KLAC) Investment Narrative?
feed.summary: Citi has issued a 30-day positive Catalyst Watch on KLA Corp (KLAC) ahead of its Investor Day on March 12, driven by expectations of a stronger financial model and potential product announcements, particularly benefiting from AI and advanced packaging demand. While this could enhance KLA's near-term investment appeal, the core risk of concentrated exposure to leading-edge capital expenditure cycles remains. The market anticipation focuses on whether the Investor Day will confirm improved long-term models and market share gains, despite some analysts' concerns about US-China trade tensions.

feed.title: Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ: ISRG) CEO reports new stock unit grants
feed.summary: Intuitive Surgical's CEO, David J. Rosa, reported several equity compensation transactions, including the acquisition of performance stock units from previous grants that met performance criteria and a new grant of 13,441 restricted stock units. Additionally, previously granted restricted stock units were exercised into common stock, with a portion withheld to cover tax obligations. Following these transactions, Rosa directly owns 232,648 shares of Intuitive Surgical common stock.

feed.title: Equity awards and tax share withholdings for Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) director
feed.summary: Intuitive Surgical director Gary S. Guthart reported equity award transactions, including new performance stock units and converted restricted stock units, alongside dispositions to cover tax withholdings. He received 8,778 performance stock units and acquired common stock through RSU vesting, while 4,963 shares were withheld for taxes at $506.17 per share. Following these transactions, Guthart directly holds 9,251 shares of common stock, with additional indirect holdings through family trusts.

feed.title: Fastenal CEO Pay Jump, Insider Buying And Contracts Versus Rich Valuation
feed.summary: Fastenal's CEO, Daniel L. Florness, saw a 59% pay increase, alongside significant insider stock purchases and the awarding of nearly $8 million in government contracts. Despite these positive indicators, the company's valuation is currently assessed as overvalued by Simply Wall St, trading above analyst targets and its estimated fair value. Shareholders are advised to consider these developments in light of the company's current valuation, its P/E ratio, and dividend coverage.

feed.title: Entergy Arkansas requests rate hike, residential bills to rise by $1
feed.summary: Entergy Arkansas is requesting a rate increase that would raise residential monthly bills by about $1.16 for households using 1,000 kilowatts. The utility filed the request with the Arkansas Public Service Commission, proposing a new rate structure that includes optional time-of-use rates, low-income rates, and agricultural rates, aiming to maintain affordability and support economic development. Entergy Arkansas also highlighted that large-scale projects, such as data centers and solar facilities, could help lower rates in the future by spreading operational costs and diversifying power sources.

feed.title: Baron Durable Advantage Fund Adjusts Holdings, Adds Quanta Services (PWR)
feed.summary: The Baron Durable Advantage Fund achieved a 2.6% return in Q4 2025, closely matching the S&P 500 Index's 2.7% gain. The fund initiated a new position in Quanta Services (PWR) and increased stakes in Danaher (DHR), while reducing holdings in Broadcom (AVGO), Mastercard (MA), and Intuit (INTU). Quanta Services, a leading provider of specialty contracting services, demonstrated robust financial health with significant revenue growth but its valuation metrics suggest it is trading at elevated levels compared to historical norms.

feed.title: Citigroup (C) offers 2036 callable zero coupon notes with 6.40% yield
feed.summary: Citigroup Inc. is offering Callable Zero Coupon Notes due March 4, 2036, with a stated principal amount of $1,000 per note and an issue price of $1,000 per note. These notes accrue at a 6.40% (non-compounding) yield and pay an accreted value of $1,640.00 at maturity. Citigroup retains the right to mandatorily redeem the notes annually starting March 4, 2027, and they are intended to qualify as TLAC-eligible debt.

feed.title: Bristol Myers Squibb Pipeline Updates And Valuation Picture For Investors
feed.summary: Bristol Myers Squibb (BMY) has reported positive Phase 2 results for Reblozyl in alpha thalassemia and received FDA acceptance for iberdomide's new drug application in multiple myeloma, which also obtained Breakthrough Therapy Designation and Priority Review. These developments are adding clinical momentum to the company's hematology and oncology pipeline. Investors should monitor the stock's valuation, which Simply Wall St estimates to be materially undervalued, and watch for further regulatory assessments and timelines, while acknowledging forecasts for flat to slightly declining earnings in the near future.

feed.title: Intuitive Hit With Patent Suit Over Robotic Surgery Devices
feed.summary: Advanced Surgical Concepts (ASC) has filed a patent infringement lawsuit against Intuitive Surgical Inc., alleging that Intuitive's da Vinci robotic surgery systems infringe upon ASC's patents. The lawsuit was filed after negotiations for a technology licensing deal between the two companies failed, with ASC claiming that Intuitive used confidential information from their meetings to develop its products without a license.

feed.title: Essex Property Trust (ESS) Downgraded to Market Perform by Raymond James
feed.summary: Raymond James has downgraded Essex Property Trust (ESS) from an 'Outperform' to a 'Market Perform' rating, with analyst Buck Horne responsible for the change. The downgrade occurred on February 27, 2026, and no new price target was announced. This follows other recent analyst adjustments for ESS, including a reiterated 'Overweight' from Cantor Fitzgerald at $300, and downgrades/price target reductions from BMO Capital and Jefferies.

feed.title: Your DTE bill is going up. Utility already has another hike in plans
feed.summary: DTE Energy is set to seek another electric rate increase in April, just days after state regulators approved a $242.4 million hike that will impact customer bills starting March 5. This new request, if approved, would likely not take effect until 2027 due to the typical year-long regulatory process. The utility notified the Michigan Public Service Commission of its intentions on February 24.

feed.title: Autonomous Research Adjusts T. Rowe Price Group PT to $83 From $87, Maintains Underperform Rating
feed.summary: Autonomous Research has revised its price target for T. Rowe Price Group (TROW) to $83, down from $87, while maintaining an "Underperform" rating on the stock. This adjustment reflects a moderated outlook on the investment management company's future performance. The article also touches upon a recent increase in T. Rowe Price's stake in Brazil's Vivara.

feed.title: After moving headquarters out of town, Charles Schwab has a new home in San Francisco
feed.summary: Charles Schwab is relocating its San Francisco offices to 425 Market St., ending its nearly two-decade stay at 211 Main St., which previously served as its headquarters. This move comes after the company shifted its headquarters out of San Francisco. The specific details of the lease and timeline were not immediately available beyond the confirmation of the relocation from a company spokesperson.

feed.title: Sleep Tech Demand Fuels ResMed
feed.summary: ResMed is transitioning from a medical device manufacturer to a digital health platform, driven by increasing demand for sleep apnea therapy, margin expansion, and recurring software revenue. While pharmaceutical treatments for obesity and sleep apnea pose a long-term competitive threat, the company's integrated software ecosystem and strong financial performance indicate continued growth. Its latest Q2 Fiscal Year 2026 results show approximately $1.4 billion in revenue, an 11% year-over-year increase, with significant profit growth attributed to manufacturing efficiencies and a favorable product mix.

feed.title: [Form 4] FLOWERS FOODS INC Insider Trading Activity
feed.summary: David M. Roach, Chief DSD Operations Officer at Flowers Foods Inc., reported insider trading activity. On February 25, 2026, he acquired 10,672 shares through the vesting of contingent performance share units and disposed of 4,343 shares at $9.65 each to cover tax obligations. Following these transactions, Mr. Roach directly holds 157,865 shares and indirectly holds an additional 20,341.39 shares via a 401(k) plan.

feed.title: Royal Bank Of Canada Forecasts Strong Price Appreciation for Targa Resources (NYSE:TRGP) Stock
feed.summary: Royal Bank of Canada has raised its price target for Targa Resources (NYSE:TRGP) to $260 from $218, maintaining an "outperform" rating and implying a 10.49% upside. This follows Targa's recent quarterly earnings report where it surpassed EPS estimates but slightly missed revenue projections. Insiders also sold a substantial amount of shares, totaling approximately $7.6 million.

feed.title: Generac settles $200M lawsuit over 2023 generator explosion
feed.summary: Generac Power Systems has agreed to a $206 million settlement in a lawsuit stemming from a 2023 portable generator explosion that injured six workers in Pennsylvania. The settlement, split between the company and its insurer, allows Generac to resolve all claims while denying any wrongdoing. The incident was linked to a GP15000E portable generator, a model recalled in September 2023 due to a fuel tank issue posing fire and burn hazards.

feed.title: Intact Technology Named 2026 ServiceNow U.S. Federal Partner of the Year and Worldwide AI Customer Value Partner of the Year
feed.summary: Intact Technology, an Elite ServiceNow Partner, has been recognized with two prestigious awards in the 2026 ServiceNow Partner Awards: U.S. Federal Government Partner of the Year – Americas and AI Customer Value Partner of the Year – Worldwide. This dual recognition highlights Intact's expertise in delivering complex ServiceNow solutions to federal agencies and its leadership in implementing scalable AI-driven transformation strategies that yield measurable operational impact. The awards underscore Intact's commitment to enabling highly regulated customers to achieve significant value from their ServiceNow investments responsibly.

feed.title: Gilead Sciences Inc Stock Moved Up by 3.72% on Feb 27: What Investors Need To Know
feed.summary: Gilead Sciences Inc.'s stock rose 3.72% on February 27, driven by its $7.8 billion acquisition of Arcellx Inc. to enhance its oncology portfolio, strong Q4 2025 financial results with a 5% increase in product sales, and FDA approval for expanded use of its Yescarta lymphoma treatment. The company also presented positive data from its HIV treatment pipeline, contributing to an optimistic analyst sentiment despite some valuation concerns.

feed.title: Masco (MAS) CFO uses 6,565 shares to cover equity award taxes
feed.summary: Masco Corporation's VP, CFO & Treasurer, Richard J. Westenberg, reported a tax-related disposition of 6,565 shares of common stock. These shares, valued at $71.86 each, were transferred to cover tax liabilities associated with an equity award. Following this transaction, Westenberg directly holds 40,576 shares of Masco common stock.

feed.title: Masco (NYSE: MAS) VP disposes shares to cover tax obligations
feed.summary: Richard Allan Marshall, Vice President at Masco Corporation, reported a tax-related disposition of 515 shares of Masco common stock on February 25, 2026, at a price of $71.86 per share. This transaction was executed to satisfy tax liabilities. Following this disposition, Marshall directly owns 17,496 Masco shares.
